title: 10 Herbs & Spices That Fight Inflammation: Natural Home Remedies
author: Medical Author Dr Koti Spandana; MBBS Medical Reviewer Shaziya Allarakha; MD
description: Herbs and spices, along with certain foods, may help treat various medical conditions. Learn the ten best herbs and spices to include in your diet if you suffer from chronic inflammation.
cleaned_text: Herbs and spices have been used since ancient times because of their well-known medicinal properties. They are also used to treat a few conditions such as [arthritis](https://www.medicinenet.com/arthritis/article.htm) and have the capability to fight inflammation. Inflammation is a normal response to any infection or injury, but it can also last longer in certain cases. Hence, what is known as chronic inflammation is linked to various conditions. Along with the aforementioned list below, various foods have anti-inflammatory properties, such as: - Mushrooms - Nuts - Purple potatoes Additionally, a few animal-based products have anti-inflammatory properties, such as chicken and eggs. 10 herbs and spices to fight inflammation Here are the 10 herbs and spices that fight inflammation: - Turmeric: - A bright yellow spice that has been used for centuries. - Contains curcumin, which is known for its anti-inflammatory properties. - Used as a natural healing agent and helps reduce inflammation and [pain](https://www.medicinenet.com/pain_management/article.htm)in people with [arthritis](https://www.medicinenet.com/arthritis_symptoms_and_signs/symptoms.htm). - Boosts immunity, helps treat [allergies](https://www.medicinenet.com/allergy/article.htm), maintains blood [sugar](https://www.medicinenet.com/sugar_addiction_pictures_slideshow/article.htm)levels, and lowers [blood pressure](https://www.medicinenet.com/image-collection/blood_pressure_picture/picture.htm). - Helps prevent neurological conditions such as [Alzheimer's](https://www.medicinenet.com/alzheimers_disease_causes_stages_and_symptoms/article.htm)disease. - Rich in antioxidants that fight [cancer](https://www.medicinenet.com/cancer/article.htm). [Ginger](https://www.medicinenet.com/ginger_zingiber_officinale-oral/article.htm): - Added to most Asian dishes. - A bit spicy and packed with various nutrients. - Contains properties that can suppress inflammatory molecules. - Helps improve [digestion](https://www.medicinenet.com/the_digestion_process_organs_and_functions/article.htm), prevents [vomiting](https://www.medicinenet.com/nausea_and_vomiting/article.htm)and [nausea](https://www.medicinenet.com/nausea_and_vomiting/article.htm), and eases [menstrual cramps](https://www.medicinenet.com/menstrual_cramps/article.htm). - Can be added to various dishes. - Ginger powder or grated ginger can be added to make ginger tea. - Cinnamon: - A delicious spice that aids in reducing inflammation. - Studies report that women who consume 500 mg of cinnamon daily for eight weeks significantly reduced the inflammation, [pain](https://www.medicinenet.com/pain_quiz/quiz.htm), and swelling in the joints. - Although cinnamon is recommended in smaller doses, large doses may cause [liver](https://www.medicinenet.com/liver_anatomy_and_function/article.htm)damage. - Reduces blood [sugar](https://www.medicinenet.com/sugar_quiz/quiz.htm)levels and may help maintain low [cholesterol levels](https://www.medicinenet.com/cholesterol_levels_pictures_slideshow/article.htm). - Some herbal medicine practitioners recommend adding a teaspoon of cinnamon powder to one tablespoon of honey and having it early in the morning before breakfast to achieve the benefits of cinnamon. - Black pepper: - The main compound of black pepper is the alkaloid piperine, which has anti-inflammatory benefits. - Piperine may be effective in early acute inflammation. - However, a few studies reported that when added with turmeric and ginger, black pepper has the same medicinal value as prescription medicines that helps relieve pain in people with [osteoarthritis](https://www.medicinenet.com/osteoarthritis/article.htm). - Black peppers have antibacterial and antioxidant properties. [Garlic](https://www.medicinenet.com/garlic_allium_sativum_l-oral/article.htm): - A beneficial ingredient that can be added to any dish. - Packed with powerful anti-inflammatory properties that relieve pain. - Contains organosulfur compounds that relieve inflammation. - Beneficial in treating the [common cold](https://www.medicinenet.com/common_cold/article.htm)and easing digestion. - May reduce the risk of [cancer](https://www.medicinenet.com/cancer_101_pictures_slideshow/article.htm)and improve [heart](https://www.medicinenet.com/heart_how_the_heart_works/article.htm)conditions. - Spinach: - A green leafy vegetable that is commonly available. - A good source of [vitamin E](https://www.medicinenet.com/vitamin_e-oral/article.htm), which protects the body from inflammatory compounds called cytokines and helps relieve pain and swelling in [osteoarthritis](https://www.medicinenet.com/osteoarthritis_oa_symptoms_and_signs/symptoms.htm). - Rich in [vitamin A](https://www.medicinenet.com/vitamin_a-oral/article.htm), which helps improve vision besides acting as a potent antioxidant. - Can be eaten in a cooked spinach salad with avocado. - Oregano: - A favorite topping on pizza that may offer health benefits. - Contains a powerful substance called beta-caryophyllene that helps fight inflammation. - Helps relieve conditions such as arthritis. - Fights [bacterial infections](https://www.medicinenet.com/bacterial_infections_101_pictures_slideshow/article.htm)and viral infections. - Rich in antioxidants that help fight [cancer](https://www.medicinenet.com/cancer_quiz/quiz.htm)-causing cells. [Ginseng](https://www.medicinenet.com/ginseng_eleutherococcus_and_panax_sp-oral/article.htm): - The root of the plant belongs to the genus Panax ginseng is very commonly seen in Asian countries. - It is believed that people used to take ginseng during the olden days for its wide range of health benefits. - Ginsenosides are active compounds of ginseng that help reduce inflammation. - Helps boost energy, prevent [flu](https://www.medicinenet.com/influenza/article.htm)infections, treat male [erectile dysfunction](https://www.medicinenet.com/erectile_dysfunction_ed_impotence/article.htm)syndrome, and lower blood sugar levels. [Green tea](https://www.medicinenet.com/green_tea_camellia_sinensis-oral/article.htm): - Has anti-inflammatory properties. - Epigallocatechin-3-gallate (EGCG) is rich in green tea, suppressing the genes that cause inflammation and thus acts as an anti-inflammatory substance. - A small amount of EGCG is present in apples, nuts, avocados, and blueberries, but green tea has the most. - Green tea helps ease digestion, [flush](https://www.medicinenet.com/hot_flashes/article.htm)out toxins from the body, and [lose weight](https://www.medicinenet.com/weight_loss/article.htm). - Cayenne: - A popular spice that is used worldwide. - Cultured to embrace various health benefits such as cayenne and hot chili peppers, helps relieve arthritis symptoms and eases digestion. - All chilies contain anti-inflammatory compounds called capsaicinoids that aid in reducing pain and swelling in arthritis and [headaches](https://www.medicinenet.com/headache/article.htm), help to prevent [blood clots](https://www.medicinenet.com/blood_clots/article.htm), and act as a natural detox of your body. - Furthermore, capsaicinoids help treat common colds and boost the immune system. - Add these chilies to flavored soups, stews, or dishes.
